<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 118, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 194, 368, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Multiple Choice (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 170, 905, 186]]<|/det|>
0625/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 194, 905, 210]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 217, 905, 231]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 247, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 437, 293]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[217, 291, 539, 320]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 337, 228, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 353, 910, 522]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.- For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Write in soft pencil.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.- Do not use correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 565, 570, 612]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- Each correct answer will score one mark.- Any rough working should be done on this question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[268, 847, 728, 864]]<|/det|>
This document has 16 pages. Any blank pages are indicated.

<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 562, 589, 580]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 621, 890, 640]]<|/det|>
The gravitational field strength on Earth is greater than the gravitational field strength on Mars.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 705, 621, 724]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 129, 134, 147]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 129, 480, 147]]<|/det|> This is the lowest possible temperature. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 157, 133, 175]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 156, 428, 175]]<|/det|> Particles in a solid start vibrating. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 183, 133, 201]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 183, 428, 201]]<|/det|> Particles do not have any weight. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 208, 133, 227]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 208, 594, 225]]<|/det|> Particles have the least gravitational potential energy. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 254, 109, 272]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 254, 922, 287]]<|/det|> Four students are asked to state and explain the relative magnitudes of the thermal expansion of solids and gases. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 298, 329, 316]]<|/det|> Which student is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 327, 133, 345]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 327, 866, 344]]<|/det|> Gases expand more than solids because the molecules in a gas are in random motion. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 352, 133, 370]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 352, 920, 384]]<|/det|> Gases expand more than solids because the attractive forces between molecules are much weaker in gases. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 393, 133, 411]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 393, 846, 411]]<|/det|> Solids expand more than gases because the molecules are closer together in solids. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 420, 133, 437]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 420, 887, 437]]<|/det|> Solids expand more than gases because the molecules in a solid are in a regular pattern. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 464, 107, 483]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 464, 479, 483]]<|/det|> Four cups A, B, C and D contain hot coffee. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 495, 504, 512]]<|/det|> Which cup keeps the coffee warm the longest? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 190, 134, 208]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 191, 329, 208]]<|/det|> 80 counts per minute <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 217, 131, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 217, 329, 235]]<|/det|> 90 counts per minute <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 243, 133, 261]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 243, 339, 261]]<|/det|> 100 counts per minute <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 268, 133, 286]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 268, 339, 286]]<|/det|> 110 counts per minute <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 312, 104, 331]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 312, 546, 331]]<|/det|> Which statement about the Solar System is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 916, 920, 939]]<|/det|>
Cambridge Assessment International Education is part of Cambridge Assessment. Cambridge Assessment is the brand name of the University of Cambridge Local Examinations Syndicate (UCLES), which is a department of the University of Cambridge.
